Issues.Title: Porting bug fix: Smart Tag window does not render at all\correctly on secondary monitor when PMA is enabled
Issues.Body:
**Issue:** When PMA mode is enabled, smart tag window does not render correctly or some of the options in the window are not accessible through mouse. It happens because of DPI awareness context mismatch between the control window and its corresponding mouse hook.

**Fix**: Determine DPI awareness context of the control window and set it in its mouse hook.

**Note:** This fix is a port from net fx runtime

**Testing done:** Since smart tags is a design time feature and is not supported by netcore designer yet, it can be tested. However I ran few sample netcore apps and ensured that there is no regression.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Porting bug fix: Smart Tag window does not render at all\correctly on secondary monitor when PMA is enabled" (#1331)

Issues.Title: Build.cmd errors: Cannot modify the return value of 'EventHandlerService.GetTestAccessor()'
Issues.Body:
Running Build.cmd on a clean machine lists lots of following errors:

System\Windows\Forms\Design\EventHandlerServiceTests.cs(55,13): error CS1612: Cannot modify the return value of 'EventHandlerService.GetTestAccessor()' because it is not a variable [C:\g\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms.Design\tests\UnitTests\System.Windows.Forms.Design.Tests.csproj]

Its related to PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1249

Requesting @RussKie to take a look.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Build.cmd errors: Cannot modify the return value of 'EventHandlerService.GetTestAccessor()'" (#1312)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: Fixing MenuStrip items control type property
Issues.Body:
Fixes #1328 

## Proposed changes
- Change control type property for items of first MenuStrip layer

### Before
Menu items of first MenuStrip layer have control type property as "menu item"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/60996511-65fee380-a35d-11e9-8b0b-cf397ffe0320.png)

### After
Menu items of first MenuStrip layer have control type property as "menu"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/60996526-6a2b0100-a35d-11e9-926f-bd5f29e7d78f.png)

## Accessibility testing  
- Used the Inspect tool to check control type property of items

## Test environment(s) 
- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18362.175]
- .NET Core SDK. Version: 3.0.100-preview6-012264
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Accessibility: Fixing MenuStrip items control type property" (#1329)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: Incorrect control type is defined for all menus like 'File and Edit and View and Tools...' in MenuStrip
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.1-preview8-012981
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes

**Problem description:**
*User Experience:*  
User who depends on screen reader won't be able to get the correct purpose of the controls on tool, if Incorrect control type is defined for all menus like 'File and Edit and View and Tools...' on SSMA.

**Repro steps:**
1. Create new .Net Core app
2. Add MenuStrip control to Form
3. Add some items to MenuStrip
4. Open the Inspect tool and look on control type of items of the first MenuStrip layer

**Actual behavior:** 
Incorrect control type 'Menu item' is defined for all menus like 'File and Edit and View and Tools...'. Control type 'Menu item' is defined for file and under file controls also defined menu item.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/60995150-9e50f280-a35a-11e9-8099-16c34113689e.png)


**Expected behavior:**
Correct control type only 'Menu' should be define for all menus like 'File and Edit and View and Tools...'.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/60995195-b0cb2c00-a35a-11e9-9273-8491d2d1e111.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility: Incorrect control type is defined for all menus like 'File and Edit and View and Tools...' in MenuStrip" (#1328)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[master] Update dependencies from dotnet/core-setup" (#1307)

Issues.Title: ComboBox.SelectedIndexChanged not firing if SelectedIndex is set before OnHandleCreated
Issues.Body: Setting ComboBox.SelectedIndex in a form's constructor disables further firing of the SelectedIndexChanged event, in .NET Core. It seems it has to do with the availability of the window and control handles. It works OK in the full framework, but it fails in .NET Core. Looks like a breaking change.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ComboBox.SelectedIndexChanged not firing if SelectedIndex is set before OnHandleCreated" (#1311)

Issues.Title: Rename Config to config
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #1304 
https://github.com/dotnet/core-eng/issues/6868#issuecomment-509375608

## Proposed changes

- Rename "NuGet.Config" to "NuGet.config"

With https://github.com/dotnet/arcade-services/pull/477 we started consuming "NuGet.config". Since git is case sensitive we look for this exact name.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Rename Config to config" (#1306)

Issues.Title: Dependencies are not getting updated
Issues.Body:
Dependency updates seem to have stalled on dotnet/winforms. 

The last update was 14 days ago, approximately. See https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aclosed+author%3Aapp%2Fdotnet-maestro. 

Triggering subscriptions manually doesn't seem to have any effect either. 

/cc @merriemcgaw, @AdamYoblick, @RussKie 
/cc @wtgodbe
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dependencies are not getting updated" (#1304)

Issues.Title: Update dependenices
Issues.Body:
Update dependencies manually - temporary workaround for https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/1304

This change was generated by running `darc update-dependencies --channel ".Net Core 3 Dev"`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update dependenices" (#1305)
